posts.post_content:
One of my all time favorite cards [Serra Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Serra Angel) just become irrelevant. Seriously, this at 3WW is absurd. I'm not going to say they killed Magic 2010 by printing this, but they sure crippled it.. In limited this dominates battlefield and in constructed it's still awesome. In legacy it rocks and in vintage it's just ok. At least they didn't add protection from black and red. 5/5 normally, but 4/5 from a vintage player's standpoint.
  
Casual play is just as frustrating for some if they keep printing stuff like this.
posts.html:

Posted By: revilolee (11/4/2009 5:27:27 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: As a huge fan of white Angel cards, of course I am thrilled to have this one in a deck! But, I must admit that the first time I saw it, I thought, "Shouldn't there be at least one more W in its cost?" It just seems so blatantly unbalanced. It really should have been 3WWW or 4WWW. Either way, with all of those white-type abilities, it should have had at least WWW in its cost. The "protection from Demons and from Dragons" part doesn't bother me too much. There are plenty of decks out there that won't be affected by these abilities at all. It's the fact that she's a 5/5 with flying, first strike, and lifelink. With these abilities alone, she should cost at least one more White.
posts.html:

Posted By: VirtueVsVice (2/2/2010 11:37:11 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
It's a powerful creature card with an efficient casting cost. Because of that, the card is insanely priced, especially since it was in a deck that won a Pro Tour qualifier. Even though there are plenty of low-cost creature removal cards in all formats, Baneslayer Angel demands attention when it enters the battlefield. It is a threat that cannot be ignored.  
  
[Juzám Djinn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Juzám Djinn) is also a creature card that has a high retail price, because it is powerful and efficient for its casting cost. Thus, even after Baneslayer Angel rotates out of Standard, I expect its retail price to remain relatively high.
posts.html:
It's a powerful creature card with an efficient casting cost. Because of that, the card is insanely priced, especially since it was in a deck that won a Pro Tour qualifier. Even though there are plenty of low-cost creature removal cards in all formats, Baneslayer Angel demands attention when it enters the battlefield. It is a threat that cannot be ignored.

Juzám Djinn is also a creature card that has a high retail price, because it is powerful and efficient for its casting cost. Thus, even after Baneslayer Angel rotates out of Standard, I expect its retail price to remain relatively high.

posts.post_content:
so overpowered it makes sane people cringe, yes any white players love it, but this is just power creep going too far, this is near invincible and will haunt magic for years, there will be one nailed to the wall in every designer's room with a sign, NEVER AGAIN, just as a warning to them to never let something like this happen again, it was completely uncalled for  
  
Bogarden Hellkite is the closest thing in terms of power in the same set to this card and even then, that is fairer, a 5/5 flying flasher that blasts multiple things when it comes in priced reasonably for its abilities

I understand this card is balanced for standard but for casual games with friends and stuff this card is completely broken. It should cost like ![3](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=3&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol) maybe more...
  
And why do all the T2 decks need to have so many removals just to get rid of this? I mean I haven't seen any T2 deck with less that 2 kind of removals X4 each... All in case someone cast all these crazy creatures that are T2 such as [Terra Stomper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terra Stomper) this, and the 9/9 shroud (Whitch posses the less threat of all.)
  
   
And another thing that I don't understand is that they excuse this by making it Mythic Rare? Ok wizards let me know then if you make another rarety such as Epic Rare and put something like:
  
   
Ultra Super Power Savant Monster ![3](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=3&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol)   
Haste, Trample, Double Strike
  
6/5
  
   
And I promise you that you will get some fanatic player who would pay with their lives to get it but the games would have been already ruined. So what do you prefer? To make money or to make a game that will last for generation... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

What about the removal for black... Doomblade just doesn't/wont cut it! Doesn't work against black *(Though this Angel is white, the point is, the usefullness of doomblade is limited)*!!
